alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 8:24PM CST until December 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow Ending But Periodic Freezing Drizzle Still A Threat... .Snow reports have varied from 2 to as much as 5 inches across much of the area today. While the back edge of most of the snow has shifted east, some linger light snow and periodic freezing drizzle continues, especially near the Mississippi River and into Wisconsin. Due to snow covered roads and the freezing drizzle threat, continue to drive with caution if you must travel this evening. Allow extra braking distances and allow extra travel times. Conditions have been improving across parts of northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow transitioning to freezing drizzle. Additional snow up to an inch, plus a glaze of ice accumulation. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
